text: there is absolutely a broken heart
syndrome called takotsubo cardiomyopathy
the broken heart syndrome classically we
think of an emotional stress it can also
be physical stress overall we'll see it
in people who have been in a stressful
environment and it can present chest
pain shortness of breath and in the
hospital it shows findings of
abnormalities on the electrocardiogram
blood enzyme is being elevated and we
can see when we look at the squeezing of
the heart that the heart is not
squeezing normally the treatment
initially is to find out if the reason
for the heart attack is from a classic
blockage of the blood vessel and then to
use the same medications to support the
heart luckily in many cases the heart
function improves back to normal but we
have to be very aggressive when somebody
has a broken heart syndrome to make sure
that we're treating it that it's
receiving the same medications to
strengthen the heart and to give the
heart time to improve itself
